issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Query Processor
components.description: Tracks issues dealing with query processing.

fields.description:
When executor alter partition onto a table which existed not in current database, InvalidOperationException thrown.

SQL example:
{code}
use default;
ALTER TABLE anotherdb.test_table_for_alter_partition_nocurrentdb partition(ds='haihua001') CHANGE COLUMN a a_new BOOLEAN;
{code}

We see this code in {{DDLTask.java}} potential problem that not transfer the qualified table name with database name when {{db.alterPartitions}} called.
{code}
      if (allPartitions == null) {
        db.alterTable(alterTbl.getOldName(), tbl, alterTbl.getIsCascade(), alterTbl.getEnvironmentContext());
      } else {
        db.alterPartitions(tbl.getTableName(), allPartitions, alterTbl.getEnvironmentContext());
      }
{code}

stacktrace:
{code}

fields.summary: alter partition onto a table not in current database throw InvalidOperationException

ATTACHMENT ID: 12881656 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Seems failed test result is not related with this patch. cc [~pxiong] [~alangates] thanks for review in advance.
In general looks good.  Rather than constructing the tablename with getDbName() + '.' + getTableName() you should call Warehouse.getQualifiedName().
Cancelling patch pending changes and a new patch since the existing one has gotten out of sync.
Thanks [~alangates], and now I have rebased this patch to the newest master branch and make call Warehouse.getQualifiedName() instead of directly concat the qualified name.
